name: Fènglísū
short_description: Delight in Taiwanese fènglísū, where a buttery, crumbly crust encases a tangy pineapple filling. This beloved treat captures the essence of Taiwan’s culinary heritage in every bite.

name: Beef noodle soup (Niúròu miàn)
short_description: Steaming bowls of savory beef noodle soup warm the hearts of Taiwan's locals, combining tender beef, aromatic ginger, and fragrant star anise in a rich broth. A beloved winter comfort food, it showcases the island's culinary pride.

name: Braised Pork Rice (Lu rou fan)
short_description: Juicy ground pork, braised to perfection in soy sauce and fragrant five-spice, creates a savory delight in this Taiwanese comfort food. Served over fluffy rice, it’s a beloved staple rich in tradition.

name: Taiwanese Popcorn Chicken
short_description: Bite-sized chicken pieces are marinated in a savory blend of soy sauce, garlic, and spices, then deep-fried to crispy perfection. A beloved Taiwanese street food, each crunchy morsel bursts with flavor.

name: Gua bao
short_description: Soft steamed buns cradle succulent pork belly, braised to perfection in soy sauce and red wine. A beloved Taiwanese street food, each bite bursts with rich, savory flavors and cultural heritage.

name: Taiwanese Scallion Pancake
short_description: Crispy on the outside and chewy within, these Taiwanese scallion pancakes pack a savory punch with layers of fresh scallions. A beloved street snack, they are often dipped in soy sauce for an extra flavor boost.

name: Oyster omelette (Kēzǎi jiān)
short_description: Savory oysters mingle with fluffy eggs in this beloved Taiwanese street food, enhanced by crispy potato starch and a drizzle of light soy sauce for a delightful umami kick.

name: Suncake
short_description: Originating from Taichung City, the suncake enchants with its flaky layers and sweet malt filling. This beloved Taiwanese pastry boasts a delicate texture, perfect for indulging in a sunny snack.

name: Turkey Rice
short_description: Shredded turkey glistens with savory soy sauce and rich lard, served atop fluffy rice. A beloved Taiwanese comfort food, it offers a delightful balance of tender meat and aromatic shallots.

name: Tian bu la
short_description: Taiwanese tian bu la delight with their crispy exterior and tender, fish-infused interior. Made from seasoned white fish, eggs, and a blend of flours, they’re deep-fried to golden perfection, offering a savory bite that captures the essence of local street food culture.

name: Taiwanese Hot Pot
short_description: Warm up with a comforting bowl of Taiwanese hot pot, a beloved winter staple. Bathed in rich, fragrant broth, it features an array of fresh meats, seafood, and vegetables, each simmering to perfection at your table.

name: Braised beef noodle soup (Hóngshāo niúròu miàn)
short_description: Wheat noodles swim in a rich, savory broth, infused with tender braised beef, chili bean paste, and hints of ginger and tomato. A beloved Taiwanese staple, it warms the soul with every slurp.

name: Mooncake (Yuebing)
short_description: Savor the rich tradition of the Mid-Autumn Festival with a mooncake, a flaky pastry filled with sweet lotus seed paste or red bean. Each bite offers a delightful blend of flavors, symbolizing unity and reunion.

name: Tshuah-ping
short_description: Finely shaved ice from Taiwan delights with a medley of fresh fruits like mangoes and litchis, drizzled with sweet condensed milk and flavored syrups. A refreshing treat perfect for warm days!

name: Ô-á mī-sòa
short_description: Savor the rich, savory depths of Taiwan's ô-á mī-sòa, where delicate wheat vermicelli mingles with briny oysters in a fragrant broth of garlic, ginger, and rice wine. A beloved comfort food, it’s a must-try for noodle lovers.

name: Hî-ôan
short_description: Delight in Tamsui's famous fish balls, where delicate fish paste envelops savory marinated pork and garlic. Some include rich shark meat for an unforgettable flavor experience.

name: Tà-á-mī
short_description: Originating from Tainan, tà-á-mī features thick wheat noodles swimming in a rich shrimp-flavored broth, topped with savory minced pork and a succulent shrimp. Each slurp offers a comforting taste of Taiwanese street food culture.

name: Ti-huih-ko
short_description: Coated in pig's blood and sticky rice, this unique Taiwanese street food is steamed or fried, then glazed with a sweet pork soy broth. A savory delight rich in local tradition!

name: Pepper bun (Hujiao bing)
short_description: Originating from Fuzhou, Taiwan's pepper bun features a crispy, golden crust filled with savory ground pork, fragrant ginger, and garlic. It's a flavorful street food delight, bursting with umami and warmth.

name: Rùn bǐng
short_description: Delicate and savory, these Taiwanese steamed spring rolls embrace a medley of fresh ingredients wrapped in soft popiah skin. Each bite bursts with flavor, celebrating the vibrant street food culture of Taiwan.

name: Tōa-tn̂g pau sió-tn̂g
short_description: A beloved Taiwanese street food, this dish features a juicy pork sausage nestled in a sticky rice casing, all grilled to perfection. The savory flavors and unique texture create a mouthwatering experience.

name: Mango Shaved Ice
short_description: Originating from Taiwan, this delightful frozen treat features fluffy mango-flavored ice topped with juicy mango cubes and a drizzle of sweet condensed milk, creating a refreshing burst of tropical flavor.

name: Kòng-ôan
short_description: Delight in the chewy texture of bouncy meatballs, a beloved Taiwanese street food. Seasoned ground pork mingles with fragrant shiitake mushrooms, delivering a savory burst of flavor in every bite.

name: Thih-nn̄g
short_description: Originating from Tamsui District, iron eggs are marinated and repeatedly simmered for a savory, smoky flavor. Their firm, rubbery texture makes them a unique and irresistible Taiwanese snack.
